Ok for me so far, olthough charging §1 for any small transaction to/ftom solid currency is a way to much and demotivated me to learn by playing.

"Support" politely informed me that I cannot cash out my remaining balance, which qualifies for THEFT. As the "Support" disconnected me abruptly, I could not save the Support Case Number.

Caution! Caution!  I had a Coinbase account for a few years mostly small dollars.  I recently moved over $40K into my account and Coinbase immediately froze it for security reason.  Original hold was for 7 days.  After verification that all was good, on day 6 Coinbase increased hold to 30 days.  Then 3 days later after another verification process, Coinbase restarted the 30-day clock. Pretty sure in 30 days Coinbase will find another reason to lock out funds for even longer.  Best not to ever use them if you value you funds or expect customer service.

I’ve been using Coinbase for 2 years. Woke up today to a message that my account has been suspended without providing any reason. When I tried to withdraw my remaining funds to my bank it would say “can’t withdraw due to connection issues” after talking to their customer support for about an hour I received zero help, the customer support clearly didn’t have any idea of what they are doing. All I got was “you’ll be contacted by email asap”I would highly recommend checking out other platforms.

You can’t. They can lock/ restrict/close your account at any time and with no reason explained. Although they look all hi tech and professional they are scammers and their customer service is a joke. I am in the process of retrieving my money from them- the formal complaint takes 45 business days to process. All this time they will be holding your money hostage. Their customer service is very circular providing no solution- bouncing customers from one chat to another, you CANNOT talk to a real person. Beware and if do use them dont hold a lot of money there- you will not be able to get them out.

Customer support qualifies for the worst possible score. They reply with the same text all the times: "We apologize for the inconvenience, but your inquiry details did not successfully transfer over to this case. In order for us to better assist you, can you please provide information or clarification as to how we can help?"AND IMMEDIATELY after this message they close the case. And they NEVER reply to my follow up email in which I resend the question according to their request. Probably this is the technique for the customer care staff to spare the work. Strange is different personas send the same canned text, like if it was not one person's technique... They reply and close the ticket, and if they are not checked further technically it looks like a resolved case. This happened now the second time with the same problem.

I have been a customer for a couple years using the service sometimes as investment (only $2000-3000), and primarily to fund online activities. Over the last few month I noticed the fee in and out increasing everytime I moved money. Then a couple days ago I moved $88. The fee was $68 leaving me $20 actually sent. The worst part was there is absolutely no warning. An hour later I was finally able to chat with customer service who said too bad, the "blockchain" decides the fee. I am definitely out of coinbase.
I am new in Coinbase, but this app seems to work normally.Having some more experience, I will write more in my review.

I have transferred £1000 to my coinbase account on Feb 8th using WesternUnion. WesternUnion confirmed the funds successfully reached the Coinbase Bank Account.Coinbase has never deposited my money on my Coinbase account and they have keep telling me they have sent the money back to Western Union without providing any evidence they have done so.Coinbase steal my funds!!! Rubbish company, I am now raising a formal legal case and raise it with the financial-ombudsmanTHis company is rubbish despite being listed on the New York stockexchange they do not comply with financial institution FCA rules.It is impossible to speak to anyone they only speak through chat bots and emails. Their employees are incompetent  and ignorant to understand the situation After 3 months they are still asking me to provide my bank account statement to show i have not received the funds, they are so ignorant the do not understand I have used Western UNion and if they have not received the fund back from Coinbase bank there is no money returned to my back account...If they cannot handle traditional banking system imagine how much crypto they steal from people with micro transaction! The company must be closed down, and investigated and audited

They subsequently locked me out of my account. Now when I attempt to verify my UK address I receive a notification stating ‘incorrect country’. I now live abroad and when I raise a complaint/ticket, it automatically closes the case and sends me an email advising ‘Initially, Coinbase will only offer self-help customer support in your region’. Apparently it’s not possible to call the helpline from outside the UK either. There is no further avenue to solve this issue. An average rating 1.6* based on 9,000 reviews says it all really. Avoid.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Awful customer support and KYC process
list_of_reviews.review: I have opened an account at Coinbase in December and they still haven't removed my limitations as my account is still under manual review. The KYC process take too long, especially since they reply to my emails every 30 days approximately. I have sent all the required documents in every iteration of their requests, but they always come back with additional ones that weren't there before. Why not just ask me all the required documents and questions straight away? And now I wait for 30 days between each request until god knows when. It's been almost 5 months and the customer support is slow and unable to give me any straight answers.

Transferred $4500 of GUSD to my wallet, they stole the funds and there is no way to get any support or get the money back.  Coinbase is 100% a scam.Reply to the coinbase reply:I tried to contact support several times, every time they say "I'm looking into that now, give me a while to look" and they never reply ever again....They have never given me a case number and it seems impossible to talk to a human.Second update.  After seeing my review Coinbase support contacted me and was able to resolve my issue.  It's a shame that the only way to contact support is to write a review here, but at least they solved the issue.

list_of_reviews.review: The ratings on here do not represent the site. I feel the majority number of ratings are done by people who are not familiar with crypto, or only use it in exchange if there's no other option before exchanging for fiat. Coinbase has treated me extremely well, and i do feel safe. Coinbase pro and all of the new features/futures/learn and earn. It's a good very easy to use exchange with endless opportunity. Once everything is dialed in with latency during major moves/max traffic in bull markets this is 5 star review for me.

Scam, be careful. They just take the money and don’t let you withdraw it in any way! They simply delete old bank accounts and prohibit the withdrawal of cryptocurrency. They don’t make any refunds, and technical support just comes up with new reasons every time why you can’t get your money back.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Stay away!!  They will steal your money!!
list_of_reviews.review: Terrible service!!!  My account has been restricted from May of last year!!  All the documents were submitted,  all questions answered - nothing changes..  Call their customer service a dozen of times,  but it is useless.  All they do is email the KYC team asking to review the submitted paperwork. Totally a joke!!  Filed a complaint with their complaint department several times( they can review it up to 90 days!),  received an answer that the KYC team is still waiting for me to submit the paperwork!!  I called Support,  sked which paperwork I still need to submit - they responded that all necessary paperwork was submitted already and that the KYC team just needs to review it. 🤷‍♂️ Recently begin to receive generic emails from KYC team requesting to confirm my account and providing with the FAQ links to the general info. The last link they send me with the request to provide the info was broken! I replied to the email with explanation and screenshots- no response. Called the customer service- no results . And there is NO Time-limits for them to review your KYC info.Mine has been in “a manual review “ for 6 months now…My account with $20,000 is restricted. Not able to withdraw my money, not able to buy coins or anything else…Filed a complaint again… I got a feeling that they are just regular scammers and the owner will be another Bankman-Fried from FTX and end up in jail.Bad ,bad actors. Do NOT recommend!!!! P.S.Read on Reddit that it was still possible to withdraw your coins while the account was under review . Withdrawing mine for sure!!!

list_of_reviews.review: I've spent over two hours trying to get registered on Coinbase. Unbelievable, and utterly incredibly bad experience. Does Coinbase actually want customers? More information: 07 May 2024 - I also chatted with an agent asking for help to resolve the registration issue but they were no help at all. I got stuck in a loop - restricted investor, HNWI, or neither statement applies - and I couldn't get past it. The agent didn't help. If someone from Coinbase wants to contact me and talk me through it I'd be grateful.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Scam of a company, dirty business practices
list_of_reviews.review: Scam of a company. Be careful when trying to send any money using coinbase as they will rob you both in fees and with a nice little scam they have going. They have created a fake etherium network that they sell assets on. They then sell people fake etherium on this fake network, when you try sending to an address on the etherium network it actually ends up at the same address but in the fake internal network, they then advised the money has been lost

This site is a scam. Choose Charles Schwab instead. Coinbase makes it easy to sign up and almost impossible to cancel. Takes one minute to sign up and several phone calls and chats to cancel with only half the refund. A company that operates with such low standards cannot be trusted.

Today I sent crypto from Coinbase wallet to my Coinbase account. It appears as sent in my wallet, but that money does not appear in my Coinbase account. When I asked coinbase they said they didn't know where they went and I lost all my money. They also said that these two accounts work separately and even informed us on the phone that your money is gone and we cannot do anything. Do not use this platform, they are scammers.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Customer service leaves you wanting to cry
list_of_reviews.review: Customer service terrible.  I need to verify my account and am unable to do so due to glitch in their system.  I have uploaded a photo to an alternative link they provided me with and provided them with a submission number to verify this Submission ID #7RT3-M6RL.  Now after 24 emails, they have started at the beginning all over again, asking me to upload my photo to link I can't upload it too, OMG I have heart palpitations.

list_of_reviews.review_title: I was contacted by coinbase to provide…
list_of_reviews.review: I was contacted by coinbase to provide my ID for verification.I have done so and provided other information as requested by their KYC team.My account has been under manual review since 2020.

These guys are literal scammers, my account has been locked for four months with no reasoning behind so, along with the team being absolutely incompetent after me opening countless tickets. Even after providing all the necessary documents, they told me all I needed to do was just wait, I didn't expect to be waiting for nearly half a year, however..... Absolutely horrible.

Scam, be careful. They just take the money and don’t let you withdraw it in any way! They simply delete old bank accounts and prohibit the withdrawal of cryptocurrency. They don’t make any refunds, and technical support just comes up with new reasons every time why you can’t get your money back.

Coinbase has blocked my account, even though I did everything asked to verify my account again after my ID expired. Their online support is USELESS there is no other way to contact them, because if you try to write e mail, you will just receive automatic answer.My account is blocked for 6 months now, and they don't care about solving it.I see that others have the same problem as I have, we should all gather up and take some legal actions against coinbase, we should stick together against those frauds.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Coinbase has been a nightmare to use
list_of_reviews.review: Coinbase has been a nightmare to use. Their customer service is a ghost town—expect zero help or generic replies after long waits, if you hear back at all. The fees are outrageously high, devouring profits on even minor transactions. The platform’s reliability is a joke; it crashes during crucial trading moments, causing significant financial damage. Withdrawal processes are agonizingly slow, taking weeks., Coinbase is a disaster. Steer clear if you value your investments and peace of mind.
Great app, very secure and easy to use. Though customer support need a bit more training in resolving issues around cryptocurrency

list_of_reviews.review_title: I wish I could say nice things
list_of_reviews.review: I wish I could say nice things, but my experience was so mediocre. Besides a nice smooth interface, which I appreciate, every feature was locked out or not working. Contacting support gave little information other than "we will look into it". I cannot add a bank account, cannot withdraw to a wallet, cannot apply for the card, cannot use the futures feature, could not withdraw to a bank account for nearly 40 days, could not reliable "stake" USDC... I honestly wish I could make this my go-to CEX but everything is.. locked and has been so for over 3 months even after contacting support.

I think MEXC is the best crypto exchange. Lowest transection fees in whole market with excellent support staff..MEXC invite code inviteCode=1PbQA`Use invite code to open account and get $1000 reward..

list_of_reviews.review_title: Worst useless garbage you can image
list_of_reviews.review: Worst useless garbage you can image! They will 100x verify your ID, 100x times block you from transfering your coins and accessing your account. Scam! Scam! Scam! Customer support is non-existent.

list_of_reviews.review_title: So Coinbase now want my case reference no.
list_of_reviews.review: So. I write a review about Coinbase and their lousy approach to customer service and they now ask for my case reference number from TrustPilot. So they can post the type of generic unhelpful replies as you can see below which have nothing to do with customer service and everything to do with reputation management. My case was closed by them with no recourse in November and the review was months ago.  Too little too late!Update: Coinbase responded in the thread as I predicted saying they will look into it, but their email to me still has restrictions on my account and they won't provide a reason.  I watched their CEO Brian Armstrong recently espouse his vision for Coinbase and it is a far cry from what their customer service and compliance teams are doing to actual customers.  I gave you a chance, so now I'm closing my account...Further update.  Coinbase has now finally restored my account to full operability. It took a while so I have now updated the rating to a 3 star.PS thank God for TrustPilot!
Worst company. They wont allow me to access my account and they dont bother replying to my emails. Im lucky i didnt have money there otherwise it would be gone
very complex and not useful. It's had for any human to understand why some network or coin can not be converted / connected to some other token / network... etc...

What's wrong with my case 19210179, scammers? On Saturday I was told that in 2 hours my issue would be resolved and I would receive an email. The 72 hours that were promised to me by email also ended, just like the 24 hours that came before. I've been living in your chat for 10 days now, I've already heard all kinds of lies from you. Where is my money, thieves?

list_of_reviews.review_title: Coinbase sent us a notification that…
list_of_reviews.review: Coinbase sent us a notification that they will be closing our account for dormancy. We appealed the decision and was notified that if we funded the account, it will revert the account back to its active state. As we were unable to send a bank transfer, we chose to fund in USDC instead but we couldn't obtain any USDC deposit instructions. It has been a month since we requested for our fresh USDC deposit instructions and we have had no response from the customer service team.
Been using coinbase for 3 years....never had a single problem at all through multiple transactions

Market growth is another focal point, with discussions on staking and updates on ecosystem developments suggesting that users are actively seeking ways to enhance their investments and participate in the evolving market structure. list_of_reviews.review_title: I wish I could say nice things

Still need to wait a week, despite it JUST telling me it was instant. So, now I have $500 in Coinbase and can't even send what I wanted. Will not let me cash out - and the crypto I bought is tanking (I have zero interest in investing in it).

list_of_reviews.review_title: Faultless experience using Coinbase for 18 months…
list_of_reviews.review: I’ve been using Coinbase for 18 months now and have found it easy and faultless. Cryptocurrency filled me with apprehension so to find a fool proof app, which didn’t rip me off with crazy charges was just a joy. I’m no wizard and sure most of it was luck, but it’s been good to me so far. For anyone having a tentative first crypto experience, I’d highly recommend Coinbase as a good place to start, just don’t get carried away!

list_of_reviews.review_title: COINBASE Urgent Assistance Needed: Missing Bitcoin Transaction
list_of_reviews.review: I am writing to bring to your attention a concerning issue regarding a Bitcoin transaction on my Coinbase account. On 2023-12-30, I received a Bitcoin transaction which was initially pending. However, shortly after, my account was flagged for KYC (Know Your Customer) verification by Coinbase. This verification process took an unexpectedly long time, lasting 138 days, before finally completing. Since then, I have been unable to locate the status of my Bitcoin transaction. I am concerned that it may be missing or held in a Coinbase cold wallet due to the KYC verification process. I kindly request your prompt assistance in investigating this matter and providing clarification on the status of my Bitcoin transaction. Any information or guidance you can provide would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response. CASE ID# 19366248ZAIN AHMAD

list_of_reviews.review_title: Poor Service. No response to Case enquiry.

I initially wrote a 1* review on 24th April as I was unable to get in touch with Coinbase or access my funds. They quickly responded on TrustPilot and promised to ‘follow up with further information on how to reclaim your funds’. I’m now a month down the line having sent multiple chaser emails which have all been ignored. Clearly Coinbase care much more about complaints in the public eye, so I will continue to communicate via TrustPilot in the hopes of obtaining my money.

Another? Google play store scamming app asks for your social security number before you can delete your accountCoinbase you can take them federal laws and shove them far up their company's ass.Fu my corrupt and crooked American government

After that period, I tried to withdraw crypto to my other wallet, but they locked my account for 30 days. They assured me that I could still withdraw cash back to my bank account, but the system does not allow me to do that. Now, customer service is saying that my funds are locked for at least 50 days. Stay away from Coinbase. When you pay for $$30 monthly so they don’t take fees when you convert or sell, they still take a fee without telling you. And make it seem like it was the conversion. Use Robinhood, stay far away from Coinbase, unless you like being robbed.

Historically very strong but recently Coinbase has frozen my account and for a month now have ignored the emails sent to their compliance team to get it unlocked. Very frustrating! Funds frozen, no way to unlock - shambolic! You might not think this is an issue, but if you are a UK user it will happen to you so go elsewhere!

They stole my money. I deposited money via bank transfer and it didn't show up on my account. At this point its pretty safe to say they have robbed me and I will be contacting the police. Do not give these people 1 cent of your money.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Their app wasn't working for Android…
list_of_reviews.review: Their app wasn't working for Android users. Delayed me taking out my profits for 4 weeks.When I did final get it out using my brothers iphone ( on two seperate occasions over Christmas - due to a 48 hour block ) the delay cost me £3000.00.Took them to the Ombudsman over it. They never accepted that their app was faulty and was blocking me all the time. And their customer support are useless. And are as welcome as a fart in a space suit.As soon as the Ombudsman looked into it - they made an offer of £50.00 and she felt that was acceptable and took it on my behalf amd closed my case.Lost £3000.00 she thinks £50.00 is reasonably compensation.This is just a cheap cheap cheap nasty company. Just avoid them - better companies than these out their. "Shut my account with them"

Coinbase is a terrible company. a little over three years ago I had $100 dollars go missing from my cash account. at that point they had no live chat. So, I emailed them multiple times. Unfortunately, they never messaged me back. fast forward to 5/16/2024 money has gone missing from usd coin. I have provided them the transaction id numbers; they are saying the transactions have never taken place. and are saying there are transactions that don't show on my end. I have been transferred from one specialist to another for an hour and a half until I gave up. they just try to make you frustrated to get you to give up. several hundred dollars are just gone. I guess its good they haven't taken thousands. just beware of what they do.

Totally pathetic. Do not buy Solana or you get stuck and nothing to do but trade for other Solana junk. It really is a l crap box with a lot of rules that are not explained....ever. I got better things to do than fight with inferior wallets and apps.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Trustpilot can we have minus stars as…
list_of_reviews.review: Trustpilot can we have minus stars as this is what is needed where Coinbase is concerned.  FOUR months now I have been trying to get my account reactivated!  Sick and tired of reading from CS how they understand my frustration!  They really can't understand it!  How they have flagged up to Compliance and someone will be in contact with you!  Well that was 6 weeks ago and guess what not heard from them.  Must be on 50+ chats now and still no nearer, beginning to think Coinbase is a one man band because they clearly don't have staff in the Compliance Department on reading all the negative reviews.  In fact they clearly don't have a marketing department, part of whose job is to ensure their reviews go up positively.  Dreadful service!
Very easy to use and for me perfect to start with bitcoins or other coins

list_of_reviews.review_title: Missing Cryptos, No Communication, Poor Team
list_of_reviews.review: I have been using Coinbase Commerce for years. In April, they informed me that they were transitioning to a new system and that Coinbase Commerce accounts would be linked to individual Coinbase accounts. I followed all their instructions.I had balances in ETH and BCH in my Coinbase Commerce account. Instead of transferring them to other companies, I decided to transfer them directly to my individual Coinbase account. There was a button to facilitate this transfer for both currencies and I used it for both.However, despite the transactions being marked as complete, the balances never arrived in my wallet. It has now been two months, and despite numerous attempts to resolve this issue, I have received no substantial assistance. Occasionally, I receive vague responses, and it seems even their support team is unaware of the problem's status or solution.In summary, I have lost a total of 850 EUR, and I am extremely frustrated with the lack of communication and resolution from Coinbase Commerce. I strongly advise against using this platform and recommend others to avoid it due to the poor customer service and unresolved issues.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Utter Tripe - Avoid like the plague!!
list_of_reviews.review: This is the clunkiest and non-functional website I have ever used.  On top of that, the 'help' available is appalling.  The chat (when I eventually got hold of an actual person) is utterly pathetic and keeps dropping out and the people on the other end seem to have not the faintest idea what they are doing.  I managed (eventually) to buy some crypto currency but was restricted from buying more and they can't tell me specifically why NOT or when I can buy some more!  So, having completely wasted an hour on their (hopeless) chat help silliness, I decided to cut my losses and get off their useless platform and want to sell my crypto currency and get my money back.  Can I do that?  NO!!!  Their stupid web site keeps asking me to add a *payment* method...  It makes no sense at all!!!Avoid like the plague!  (I'm going to try eToro, next).Update 10Jun2024:  Trustpilot contacted me re this review stating that Coinbase do not "recognise your (my) review as genuine" and Trustpilot want a 'support ticket number'.  Unfortunately (as my review makes clear) I only ever used their utterly useless chat facility and, as far as I am aware, they do not operate a proper 'support ticket' system.  So, asking for one is a bit pointless.  I would also add that given my name is virtually unique on the entire planet, it would take Coinbase about 5 seconds to locate my account and (I assume) the support chat details that resulted in this review.I have since sold my crypto currency holding with Coinbase (at a considerable loss) and am in the process of trying eToro instead.  Certainly the initial sign-up and funding process was a great deal more straight forward.  MW
So far, and early days of course, the sign up and verification process has been pretty smooth. And purchase of bitcoin has been uneventful thus far. Always potential room for improvement of course

Signed up using the link and code. Verified successfully and made a deposit. No bonus, I was told by support that "the system has made your account ineligible". No explanation or rectification. You have lost a customer.

For the past three months, I have been a member of Coinbase 1, and I've just discovered this today. I am a college student and recently lost my job. I did not knowingly subscribe to this membership and don't recall signing up for it.When Coinbase attempted to withdraw money from my account for the Coinbase 1 membership fee, it failed due to insufficient funds. Instead, it withdrew the money from my savings account, resulting in an overdraft. Now, I owe my bank $30 that I cannot afford, affecting my ability to pay for essential services like garbage collection.In total, $90 has been taken from me. I am very upset and frustrated. According to the membership details, I was supposed to receive text message alerts for crypto price spikes, but I never received any. The membership also mentioned sweepstakes, which I was not informed about. I have not made any transactions or used any membership benefits in the last three months.As a struggling college student, I was completely unaware that Coinbase Global Inc., a company valued at $62.38 billion USD, was withdrawing money from my account.I have tried to contact Coinbase to resolve this issue but haven't found a way to do so. I need assistance from Coinbase to address this situation because I believe I have been wronged, and this is not how customers should be treated.
They are scammers. Don't use it. Find another site. Good luck getting your money.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Pathetic Customer Service and Automated systems.
list_of_reviews.review: Preface: Ive used Coinbase for 5+ years with no issues until today but this review is deserved by how terrible the service has been. I sent $200 in DAI into Coinbase. It said i could not trade it to cash. Weird. Okay. Try on phone. Same error. Contact support. They have no clue either. But they say that my ticket is a "Priority." LmfaoA few days later to 1 week goes by. No updates. I reach out again and again. No updates. Then my account suddenly is restricted. I KYC again. On page it says I am approved and everything is fine. I even did the KYC with the same ID i used last time. Account is still restricted. So i waited 24 hours. Nothing changes. Reach out to support. "Your account is a priority for us." Complete and total lies. So i did the KYC input again 2-3 days later after another support rep said they didn't receive anything. Okay sure. At this point its been 1.5 weeks. Wait. Nothing happens. Contact support. Rep says to email the KYC people by replying to the email they sent me. I have replied twice. NO RESPONSE. I contact support 1.5 weeks later cuz i have better things to do for $200. "Your account is a priority." Its just getting idiotic at this point. My goal in writing this review is to make someone higher up look at my account because this is insane for $200. Ive wasted like 8 hours of my life on this. Absolutely insane. All trust lost. Dont trust these people with your money. Look at the reviews on here. Its this way for a reason. UPDATE:SEE WHAT I MEAN...LOOK AT THIS INSANE RESPONSE BELOW. I have been a customer for 5+ years and I have to wait 3 weeks to be KYC'd again when ive already KYC'd twice...HAHAHAHAHA. This is PATHETIC.

list_of_reviews.review_title: INEFFICIENT SET-UP / RIDICULOUS WAIT TO START INVESTING
list_of_reviews.review: Despite all its critical acclaim at being the world's leading crypto investment platform, my account set-up has been a complete debacle! Had to go through the verification process twice, had to wait 24 hours before I could start using my account...by which time BTC had gone up 0.6%. The process to trasnfer money to enable trading didnt work initially despite various attempts, but finally got a'fast bank transfer' completed which was over clunky in itsel, but this can take up to 2 days to actually hit my account....it's a FAST bank transfer, it should be immediate! I'm STILL WAITING to make my first trade after opening my account 3 days ago, by which time the crypto Im targeting has gone up price, so missed the initial opportunity to buy effectively.I have two other industry leading trading accounts and they work significantly more efficiently than Coinbase.Seems I've been duped - as soon as my cash clears I'm withdrawing it & closing the account. Totally inept!!! DON'T BELEIVE THE HYPE!!

Horrible, horrible, horrible operation! I used the program for a month. Nothing about it is intuitive but that's not what really ticked me off. My account was put on restricted status and I would not be able to transfer coins to me hard wallet for 2-months. So in the meantime my funds were frozen. They could not give me a reason, but I would bet it was because I used a hard wallet and not their hot wallet. They couldn't hold my money after my purchases were completed. I could purchase within their platform, burt I couldn't move it out from their possesion. Crazy thing, they would allow me to withdraw it for deposit to my back. It was being held as USDC, so it was available for deposit immediately. Do not waste your time and money.

Received an email saying I had to do verification tasks and I would not be able to use the Coinbase account until I did.(had done them already / previously)Contacted the customer support via the chat.First person send ..... i had to upload selfies and verify my identity.Second person said ....After an in-depth review of your account, it appears that your account has no restrictions found and all information are verified as well. You may disregard the email that you received, I then asked for a transcript of the chat I had just had ...Unfortunately, we cannot provide you transcript of our conversation, Dave12:14 AMWhy?12:17 AMThis is because we are chat support, Dave and we are not able to provide you a transcript.Wasted 1hr of my time

Long time customer of coinbase but i think im done after this ordeal. They transferred money from my bank account and used that money to purchase bitcoin and deposit them into multiple wallets. Now once i saw this, i immediately contacted my bank but since this took place over the weekend, i had to wait for the transactions to post. I waited till Monday and contacted my bank, from there the dispute was open and i received my funds back shortly after. I contacted coinbase and told them everything that happened with sufficient evidence and responses from my bank and that was it. I reset my account's security and thats was that. Or so i thought. I see they now want me to pay back over $600, claiming that they never received MY OWN MONEY when the money from my account was confirmed to be posted and sent to coinbase. Even when i had substantial proof that the funds were 100% stolen, they still expect me to pay them. This is why im never coming back to this company.Ive talked to numerous support agents and they have all given me the exact same responses one after the other. Never coming back. This absolutely should not happen.

I've had a terrible experience with Coinbase customer support. Over the past few weeks, I've spoken to numerous representatives (probably between 50 to 100), and the process has been incredibly frustrating. One particular representative informed me that she would place a lock on my account because she "felt" it could be fraudulent, despite providing all necessary documentation to prove my identity.I have repeatedly requested that they unlock my account so I can withdraw my funds, but they keep delaying the process. Initially, they told me my account would be unlocked by the 24th of this month, but after further arguments and back-and-forth communication, they extended the date to July 16th. This feels like a deliberate attempt to withhold my funds.I understand the need for security, but this has gone beyond reasonable measures. I am deeply disappointed and feel scammed by Coinbase. They need to improve their customer service and handle cases like mine with more professionalism and urgency.I've filed a complaint with the appropriate consumer protection agencies due to their mishandling of my account. I also want to warn others that after reading this review, Coinbase might reply pretending to offer help, but in my experience, this is just a facade to appear helpful while continuing their unprofessional practices.
Do not use this company. God help you if you break your phone. They want you to sign in with your broken phone which is impossible. We're done.  No resolution. I can't access my account.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Avoid Coinbase like the plague, your profits will be eaten by fees.
list_of_reviews.review: Figured Coinbase would be better than some other exchanges, I was wrong. Bought $4,300 dollars worth, and traded at the edge of $63-64,000. After a $200 coinbase fee (meaning my subtotal was $4135.23) and my price including the spread was $64,668.74 I will leave this exchange permanently. The high of bitcoin on 23 June is 64,499 (at the time of writing). How tf my purchase cost per bitcoin was HIGHER than the the highest level today, I don't know. Do not trade here if you're expecting minimal fees/spread costs. They will rinse your profits and unfairly so. Couple that with difficulty withdrawing from the exchange, Coinbase can politely go f-k itself.

Where to start. Hit over the head with exorbitant fees with ANY move to my funds, hold times for EVERYTHING. If you deposit cash, HOLD TIME before they let me use it. If you buy crypto, HOLD TIME until I can use it transfer it. If I even attempt to withdraw money, HOLD TIME, before I can actually withdraw it. All for “security”. What bank - in this universe -takes their customers deposits and HOLDS THEM? They don’t! This is heinous. Their customer service is alsonext to non-existent. Chat only, and only after BEGGING the bot for an agent will you possibly get transferred to an “agent”. All said “agents” are completely incompetent of their jobs, and for whatever reason cannot seem to actually answer any questions. It’s always “I’m sorry for the inconvenience,”… but basically go fly a kite. They won’t lift a finger, they don’t understand my questions, nor provide ANY solutions at any time. Coinbase, meanwhile collects fees from every little transaction they can, nickel & diming everyone to a zero balance. Disgusting corporation with an absolutely horrendous “customer service” department. Unparalleled. Thousands of better ways to purchase crypto.

list_of_reviews.review: Easy to use and never had any issues. Cheap trades as well when using Pro and free to send to mates. Don't really do a lot of trading though so never really bothered about fees but for how little I use it and own I'm perfectly fine with it.

I have been forced to use Coinbase in order to receive my Celsius claim. I have never dealt with a company this bad in my life, there is not way of contacting them and their customer support takes about a month to get back to you. Imagine having to deal with something like this when money is at stake. They have been unable to approve my account to allow me to receive my claim, They have requested information for KYC on numerous occasions, often the same info I have already submitted, only to receive an email a month later (after multiple follow ups) that request more or the same info without a single explanation as to why they cant approve my account just to receive my claim which I cant receive anywhere else. Please dont trust this company with your money.

My trades are fairly large so that makes a big difference. I know the charging system and I know they are charging me three times more than they’re supposed to.

Didn't had any issues, used coinbase for more than 3 years. Withdrawing works perfectly, buying too, transferring as well. I like their new reward system a lot.Personally I recommend this CEX, very safe.

Frustrating Login IssuesI have been using the Coinbase app for a while now, but recently, I've been unable to log in. Every time I try to access my account, I get a "something went wrong" error message. This issue is incredibly frustrating, especially since I rely on Coinbase for managing my cryptocurrency investments.I've tried troubleshooting on my end—restarting my device, reinstalling the app, and ensuring that my internet connection is stable—but nothing seems to work. The lack of clear error messages or guidance on how to resolve this issue only adds to the frustration.Customer support hasn't been much help either. Despite reaching out multiple times, I have yet to receive a response that addresses the problem. The app's reliability is crucial for managing my assets, and these login issues are unacceptable.I hope Coinbase addresses this problem quickly, as it severely impacts the user experience. Until then, I cannot recommend the app to others.

Horrible, horrible, horrible operation! I used the program for a month. Nothing about it is intuitive but that's not what really ticked me off. My account was put on restricted status and I would not be able to transfer coins to me hard wallet for 2-months. So in the meantime my funds were frozen. They could not give me a reason, but I would bet it was because I used a hard wallet and not their hot wallet. They couldn't hold my money after my purchases were completed. I could purchase within their platform, burt I couldn't move it out from their possesion. Crazy thing, they would allow me to withdraw it for deposit to my back. It was being held as USDC, so it was available for deposit immediately. Do not waste your time and money.

idk if they only hire mentally disabled people for support or what, i was asking this guy when my "instant payment" was gonna go through, he made me jump through so many hoops, told me to complete some bs verification on some weird link he sent me, probably stealing my data as wellafter 2 hours of jumping through hoops he simply said my payment has been put under manual review ... so there really was no need to complete all that verification, mostly because my ACCOUNT WAS ALREADY VERIFIED AND SO WAS MY ADDRESS

Received an email saying I had to do verification tasks and I would not be able to use the Coinbase account until I did.(had done them already / previously)Contacted the customer support via the chat.First person send ..... i had to upload selfies and verify my identity.Second person said ....After an in-depth review of your account, it appears that your account has no restrictions found and all information are verified as well. You may disregard the email that you received, I then asked for a transcript of the chat I had just had ...Unfortunately, we cannot provide you transcript of our conversation, Dave12:14 AMWhy?12:17 AMThis is because we are chat support, Dave and we are not able to provide you a transcript.Wasted 1hr of my time

Long time customer of coinbase but i think im done after this ordeal. Recently had funds stolen from my account and THOUGHT the issue was completely resolved, but now they're saying i OWE THEM over $600! Why do i have to pay them when my own money was stolen from my account? Absolutely not. Will add more details. Over the weekend at the beginning of this month, my coinbase account was accessed without my knowledge and resulted in over $600 being stolen. They transferred money from my bank account and used that money to purchase bitcoin and deposit them into multiple wallets. Now once i saw this, i immediately contacted my bank but since this took place over the weekend, i had to wait for the transactions to post. I waited till Monday and contacted my bank, from there the dispute was open and i received my funds back shortly after. I contacted coinbase and told them everything that happened with sufficient evidence and responses from my bank and that was it. I reset my account's security and thats was that. Or so i thought. I see they now want me to pay back over $600, claiming that they never received MY OWN MONEY when the money from my account was confirmed to be posted and sent to coinbase. Even when i had substantial proof that the funds were 100% stolen, they still expect me to pay them. This is why im never coming back to this company.Ive talked to numerous support agents and they have all given me the exact same responses one after the other. Never coming back. This absolutely should not happen.
So far, and early days of course, the sign up and verification process has been pretty smooth. And purchase of bitcoin has been uneventful thus far. Always potential room for improvement of course

I've had a terrible experience with Coinbase customer support. Initially, they told me my account would be unlocked by the 24th of this month, but after further arguments and back-and-forth communication, they extended the date to July 16th. This feels like a deliberate attempt to withhold my funds.I understand the need for security, but this has gone beyond reasonable measures. I am deeply disappointed and feel scammed by Coinbase. They need to improve their customer service and handle cases like mine with more professionalism and urgency.I've filed a complaint with the appropriate consumer protection agencies due to their mishandling of my account. I also want to warn others that after reading this review, Coinbase might reply pretending to offer help, but in my experience, this is just a facade to appear helpful while continuing their unprofessional practices.

This seemed like a scam, so I called support. The customer service staff member took 50 minutes to even figure out what problem I was having, even though I explained the error message I was getting within the first few minutes of the call. He had me change browsers, download the app, and reupload my face verification. Which he looked at and was very unprofessional when he said "you are very pretty." When he repeated himself (as if he wanted to make sure I heard him the first time) I told him that saying that was weird. He didn't apologize. They then took the money I had e-transferred to coinbase and called it the "fee." Horrible customers service. Coinbase sucks! Why? Because their customer service is window dressing; they don't actually do anything. They make it seem like they are doing something but have no authority to act. My BTC withdrawal to my personal wallet was delayed for 72 hours, two weeks in a row. Ok, so I can understand maybe once but I was sending the BTC to the same address as the first time. Their complaint system is convoluted. You need a case number, which neither the telephone not the chat extends to you. They no longer have support tickets. Essentially, it's virtually impossible to get anything done because Coinbase ensures that the process of contacting them and having a decision made in your best interest will not happen. Their system conveys the idea that they would rather not be bothered. That's where the window dressing comes in. I had to literally beg for a support case number. After paying an exorbitant transaction fee, they delay my transaction. They suck!In response to CB's 06/25/24 reply:Your email is just more CB boilerplate BS! You have no problem with me buying and paying your hefty transaction fees but to transfer out to my own wallet a week after being flagged on a transaction to the same wallet is pure BS. I updated my ID last week. CB has gotten bigger than it can handle and consequently is tripping over itself. Get your act together; your service in the name of security is pathetic. If you have concerns about my identity send me a SMS and stop the BS!

list_of_reviews.review: Easy to use and never had any issues. Cheap trades as well when using Pro and free to send to mates. Don't really do a lot of trading though so never really bothered about fees but for how little I use it and own I'm perfectly fine with it.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Avoid Coinbase like the plague, your profits will be eaten by fees.
list_of_reviews.review: Figured Coinbase would be better than some other exchanges, I was wrong. Bought $4,300 dollars worth, and traded at the edge of $63-64,000. After a $200 coinbase fee (meaning my subtotal was $4135.23) and my price including the spread was $64,668.74 I will leave this exchange permanently. The high of bitcoin on 23 June is 64,499 (at the time of writing). How tf my purchase cost per bitcoin was HIGHER than the the highest level today, I don't know. Do not trade here if you're expecting minimal fees/spread costs. They will rinse your profits and unfairly so. Couple that with difficulty withdrawing from the exchange, Coinbase can politely go f-k itself.

The worst customer service ever. Had my wallet hacked and $41336 got stolen. I contacted their support multiple times and keep receiving an automated response. I curse the day I decided to use coin base. I can't help but to think it seams the company was designed for scam. I don't recommend this company for anyone.

Where to start. Hit over the head with exorbitant fees with ANY move to my funds, hold times for EVERYTHING. If you deposit cash, HOLD TIME before they let me use it. If you buy crypto, HOLD TIME until I can use it transfer it. If I even attempt to withdraw money, HOLD TIME, before I can actually withdraw it. All for “security”. What bank - in this universe -takes their customers deposits and HOLDS THEM? They don’t! This is heinous. Their customer service is alsonext to non-existent. Chat only, and only after BEGGING the bot for an agent will you possibly get transferred to an “agent”. All said “agents” are completely incompetent of their jobs, and for whatever reason cannot seem to actually answer any questions. It’s always “I’m sorry for the inconvenience,”… but basically go fly a kite. They won’t lift a finger, they don’t understand my questions, nor provide ANY solutions at any time. Coinbase, meanwhile collects fees from every little transaction they can, nickel & diming everyone to a zero balance. Disgusting corporation with an absolutely horrendous “customer service” department. Unparalleled. Thousands of better ways to purchase crypto.

Didn't had any issues, used coinbase for more than 3 years. Withdrawing works perfectly, buying too, transferring as well. I like their new reward system a lot.Personally I recommend this CEX, very safe.
Awesome I’m really enjoying this wallet and I am happy to recommend it to friends and relatives

When trying to withdraw my money from my account they wouldn't let me unless I first sent an e-transfer to coinbase first. So they could verify that my bank account was my bank account. This seemed like a scam, so I called support. The customer service staff member took 50 minutes to even figure out what problem I was having, even though I explained the error message I was getting within the first few minutes of the call. He had me change browsers, download the app, and reupload my face verification. Which he looked at and was very unprofessional when he said "you are very pretty." I sat in stunned silence as it was very unprofessional and I didn't want to acknowledge it. When he repeated himself (as if he wanted to make sure I heard him the first time) I told him that saying that was weird. He didn't apologize. He wasn't able to fix the issue, or even tell me that I had to do the e-transfer. He kept finding new things he thought were wrong. I got sick of waiting and ended up just doing the e-transfer to the coinbase account before being able to withdraw the money. They then took the money I had e-transferred to coinbase and called it the "fee." Horrible customers service. I was on the phone for 50 minutes before he even figured out the error message I was getting was the issue, and still wasn't able to give me an answer by 1 hour 20 minutes into the call.

I have been forced to use Coinbase in order to receive my Celsius claim. I have never dealt with a company this bad in my life, there is not way of contacting them and their customer support takes about a month to get back to you. Imagine having to deal with something like this when money is at stake. They have been unable to approve my account to allow me to receive my claim, They have requested information for KYC on numerous occasions, often the same info I have already submitted, only to receive an email a month later (after multiple follow ups) that request more or the same info without a single explanation as to why they cant approve my account just to receive my claim which I cant receive anywhere else. Please dont trust this company with your money.

Coinbase sucks! Why? Because their customer service is window dressing; they don't actually do anything. They make it seem like they are doing something but have no authority to act. My BTC withdrawal to my personal wallet was delayed for 72 hours, two weeks in a row. Ok, so I can understand maybe once but I was sending the BTC to the same address as the first time. Their complaint system is convoluted. You need a case number, which neither the telephone not the chat extends to you. They no longer have support tickets. Essentially, it's virtually impossible to get anything done because Coinbase ensures that the process of contacting them and having a decision made in your best interest will not happen. Their system conveys the idea that they would rather not be bothered. That's where the window dressing comes in. I had to literally beg for a support case number. After paying an exorbitant transaction fee, they delay my transaction. They suck!In response to CB's 06/25/24 reply:Your email is just more CB boilerplate BS! You have no problem with me buying and paying your hefty transaction fees but to transfer out to my own wallet a week after being flagged on a transaction to the same wallet is pure BS. I updated my ID last week. CB has gotten bigger than it can handle and consequently is tripping over itself. Get your act together; your service in the name of security is pathetic. If you have concerns about my identity send me a SMS and stop the BS!

Hours and hours of conversations with a bunch of lying people. My account was closed but during this time I had sent $150 of solana back to my account. After 3 hours of conversations they said it would be sent back into my original account 30 days later. Now it's 32 days later and no sign of it. Now back on to them, they are fobbing me off. I'm just glad it was only $150. Very untrustworthy site which you should stay away from. Now been speaking to many people for over 6 hours since 23rd May. I so bored of this rubbish. Will try again later, I just don't want them to nick my money after the amount of fees I have paid in the last year. Getting fobbed off then someone else would start the chat again. Shocking customer service! They are thieves!

list_of_reviews.review_title: They kept 30% of my sale of two crypto…
list_of_reviews.review: They kept 30% of my sale of two crypto coin accounts for what they call their "spread". Crypto is risky enough and then your wallet shafts you.I would certainly look elsewhere for your crypto investments. In their review they don't even look at the issue, rather they just send a pre scripted reply out of hidden terms manual.I have sold this same coin with them a couple times and this has never been a issue.When sold the coin was at $1.54 and they only paid $1.00 per coin, at 1,143 coins that amounts to $640 they took out of my sale. The kicker is the coin has only gone up since then so they didn't even need their spread.
So far, and early days of course, the sign up and verification process has been pretty smooth. And purchase of bitcoin has been uneventful thus far. Always potential room for improvement of course

It makes no sense and speaks volumes to the type of security they have or don't have in place. Stay away!

Do yourselves a favor: use Kraken instead. No issues whatsoever, excellent support.

Unable to send crypto until Sept 9. The restrictions seem to be intermittent. I was able to send crypto in dribs and drabs to my wallet. Finally today, I emptied Coinbase. Do yourselves a favor: use Kraken instead. No issues whatsoever, excellent support.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Account was hacked the end of March
list_of_reviews.review: Account was hacked the end of March, took $5000 in bitcoin. I was told that someone with a Texas IP address had hacked my account, I had no contact with anybody in Texas. They then locked me out(of course for my well being), I have tried 14 times to get back into my account, that's 14 different pics of my head, 13 pics of my drivers license(1 time I tried my VA picture ID), and 14 times a pic of me holding a sign under my chin that read Coin Base Verification and the date. Each time I was told that they couldn't verify because pics were not readable. I  even ran the pics thru picasa just to make sure they were clear. It has been 4 months now, I received an email today(7-11-2024) telling me they were going to lock me out, what an effing joke. One hand does not know what the other is doing. DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH COINBASE, THEY DO NOT STAND BEHIND THEIR CUSTOMERS!!!!!!

list_of_reviews.review_title: I used Coinbase based on the advice…

It was no small task to get an account setup on Coinbase.  I had to do a lot of work to make that happen.  I am good with security, but I sent a wire from my bank account $2 grand of which Coinbase charged me $10.  I purchased the crypto on Coinbase, but when I tried to send the crypto to simpleswap, they stopped the transaction for a review and have now said they will keep my ability to send the crypto until September 8 (60 days).  I totally regret using this service.  Please check out other exchanges before you allow these people to hold your money hostage.   They did not even give me a case # in the e-mail notifying me of their criminal action.

same story as many others here, used coinbase for a number of years now without issue, now account is blocked (with a decent sum of money held on it), cannot log in, customer service is useless, repetitive and beyond vague, cant actually help you with a problem, just keep telling me that my account is being reviewed by a mystery "higher team" but strangely can't put me through to them or tell me what they are reviewing, They also sent me an email asking me to resubmit my selfie and id docs with a link.... that requires me to log into my account, after me telling them, and the whole problem being, that I cannot log into my account because they have blocked it... utter joke, the self proclaimed "most trusted crypto exchange".... yeah right. currently seeking legal advice, save yourself the hassle if you're not already a customer, go literally anywhere else, or just set fire to your cash, be the same thing as letting clownbase near it

list_of_reviews.review_title: I wish I could give you 0 Star or minus 5
list_of_reviews.review: I was a Coinbase customer for over 8 years since I started learning about crypto. After years of studying crypto and seeking ways to profit, I realized I needed to learn Python and create a bot for arbitrage trading.I dedicated myself to learning Python, and after 2 months of intense work, I wrote a flawless code with 100% performance accuracy. I remember not sleeping for 3 nights and barely eating for 2 days while passionately working on my code.After just 2 days of my code running, Coinbase restricted my account and sent me an email notifying me of account closure!Yes, Coinbase flagged me as a high-risk customer and told me they could no longer offer their services to me.Why? Because my code worked. Because I could earn about £60-£90 a day with just £3000 in my Coinbase account. Because I was making a profit instead of losing money.Even though my total trading volume over those 2 days was £4 million, it doesn't matter. list_of_reviews.review_title: My account has been limited for 6 months.
list_of_reviews.review: I have been waiting for my account, which has been restricted for Celsius distribution, to be opened since May 29th. No information has been provided about the situation yet, and when I check, I see that my case has been closed. Something must be done about this now.

Dear Coinbase team,I am getting very tired of receiving the same standardized responses. I have been waiting for my refund for 10 days now. The refund issuer has confirmed to me that the refund was successfully processed. I do not understand why such a large and reputable company has a problem with a refund for days. I urgently need the money for my livelihood.No, you don't understand. I urgently need the money. I know some refunds take time, but I am 28 years old and have never experienced this before. I have always received refunds within a day, no matter the company. I can't buy food with your apology. I am a Coinbase One customer and don't understand why you can't issue me the refund immediately.But it doesn’t help, no matter what I say or how I try to explain the situation. You keep responding with standard and same messages. I am very frustrated. Have a nice day...
I had a glitch which, after some digging, was able to find my way to old school customer support and the issue was resolved real time. Thanks Coinbase!

list_of_reviews.review_title: Save yourself a heacache - avoid using Coinbase
list_of_reviews.review: I opened an account with Coinbase in mid-June. Within two weeks my account was restricted from sending crypto - to my self-custody wallet! The restriction was supposed to last 60 days (so ridiculous.) After spending hours chatting with customer service, the restriction was lifted. It happened all over again on July 10. Unable to send crypto until Sept 9. The restrictions seem to be intermittent. I was able to send crypto in dribs and drabs to my wallet. Finally today, I emptied Coinbase. Do yourselves a favor: use Kraken instead. No issues whatsoever, excellent support.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Coinbase is the unsafest UK crypto exchange, your money isn't safe, go with Kraken instead
list_of_reviews.review: One year later, hundreds of emails, and almost a dozen formal complaints later, I finally got access to my money again. I did nothing wrong and it was all due to their staff's mistakes. It's all documented.But now they act like nothing happened. They messed up majorly and so did their customer support team. They refuse to acknowledge.They ignore my support tickets, formal complaints, chats, calls, and so on.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Iam very pleased to use Coinbase…

Also Fees are prety low against MetaMask wallet which is so high I cant aford it. So thank you Guys keep doing the great Job.( sorry 4 my Eng.writing Im from EU )

list_of_reviews.review: As a beginner in crypto I've found coinbase easy to navigate, I've only bought,sent,sold on there but never had an issue with it. A bit sluggish at times but that's a patience thing not there problem. All in all I until I have a real problem on there I would recommend for a beginner to start with.

Dont be fooled by the amount of users they have, there are much better exchanges out there, compared to bitpanda coinbase is like a high quality scam. Withdrawing my money was such a pain I gave up and kept it on coinbase, also fees are absolutely everywhere, i feel like ive been robbed to be honest.

list_of_reviews.review_title: I WAS WRONG AND WILL ADMIT IT
list_of_reviews.review: After a couple months my account is unlocked, I can’t trade just yet but it’s progress. I said harsh things about a company that I had a pretty good understanding with for 5 years excluding 2 months so I will apologize as the bigger man say I am sorry for such childish impatience. Thanks for the debit card, easy access to almost all cryptos and decent yield on ideal usdc.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Spend 1000gbp to buy solana's and rip.
list_of_reviews.review: Spend 1000gbp to buy solana's, everything was okay till this moment, getting sms verifications and so on. The moment i spend the money in their website... BUMMM.. Cant transfer, cant withdraw, not receiving sms codes anymore, chat support is bot who is trying to convince u he's a real human and i spoke on the phone with them, 50% sure they were bots. Chat took the bot 2 hours to tell me he cannot do anything. 1 hour through the phone just because i closed the call. Can't login to my account. Literally wanted to move the solana today. If something will update but the customer support is SH!T!

I've tried to signup and as expected (they're a financial institution and they need to) they've asked for address verification.Then they rejected 3 different types of PDFs because they're not in English. OOOFFF.I've signed up for Revolut, Wise, Payoneer and wherever else you may think of, I have never ever dealt with such a LOL situation before.What a joke.PS: I don't even know if it's legal to reject an EU language if you operate in EU, but I won't bother with that, I have better things to do.Edit:Are you trolling me? I've tried again to get the same story. "Unknown document submitted. Please submit one of the supported documents."I've uploaded an official, original untouched e-statement.Unbelievable.

Hi there, Coinbase is not allowing me to withdraw crypto to another exchange. I understand that every company has technical issues every now and then, but I made Coinbase aware of this problem months ago, and it still hasn’t been resolved. I was also taking to customer support for hours today, and they still can’t solve the problem. As a result of this, I have missed out on some great trading opportunities that would have made me thousands but I couldn’t take them because my funds are stuck on Coinbase. I am writing to you to give you the opportunity to give me a settlement to make up for the thousands of pounds I could have made through trading had I been able to withdraw my funds to Bitget, as well as the large amount of stress this situation has had on me. If you are not willing to do this I will have to report this issue to a small claims court. Please let me know as soon as possible as to your decision. Kind regards, Buddy

Dear Coinbase team,I am getting very tired of receiving the same standardized responses. I have been waiting for my refund for 14 days now. The refund issuer has confirmed to me that the refund was successfully processed. I do not understand why such a large and reputable company has a problem with a refund for days. I urgently need the money for my livelihood.No, you don't understand. I urgently need the money. I know some refunds take time, but I am 28 years old and have never experienced this before. I have always received refunds within a day, no matter the company. I can't buy food with your apology. I am a Coinbase One customer and don't understand why you can't issue me the refund immediately.But it doesn’t help, no matter what I say or how I try to explain the situation. You keep responding with standard and same messages. I am very frustrated. Have a nice day...// after 15 days I received my money a few hours ago.

There are quite a few complaints online about them closing accounts with no explanation. Worse, they tell you you have to withdraw all your funds but give you no way to do so. Basically, they just steal your money.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Use Coinbase for about a year
list_of_reviews.review: Use Coinbase for about a year. Got a new phone, and can’t sign back in and there’s nowhere to find any help. Customer support is nothing but an endless circle of automated nonsense. You can’t get a hold of anyone if you can’t sign in. I can’t sign in, and I can’t get help to sign in. I guess all my money will be sucked up and lost to Coinbase. Steer clear. I’ve never had a single issue out of Robinhood and have used them for about three or four years. Stay away from Coinbase. I sold my stocks of Coinbase as well and I would suggest you do the same if you have any.

list_of_reviews.review_title: Never had an issue purchasing or…
list_of_reviews.review: Never had an issue purchasing or sending crypto. Coinbase One is a good addition too as I save a fortune using it.

If there was a lower rating than 1 star I would use it. Shockingly high fees, poor service, transactions locked (for a month) due to ‘security’ even though I had completed all relevant checks passports etc.. use anyone else

list_of_reviews.review_title: Platform is relatively easy to use
list_of_reviews.review: Platform is relatively easy to use, if very expensive. However, the customer support is truly atrocious. It's difficult to get to someone in the first instance, and if you have an issue that falls outside of the norm, it's very difficult to get a resolution. The verification process is very sluggish and doesn't work properly, leading to documents being uploaded multiple times. They really need to improve their processes, especially for a 'web3' company.

This company makes it impossible to close your account unless you have a £0.00 balance - which is exceedingly hard to do with "dust" from cryptocurrency. Leaves the open accounts subject to fraud, etc.

If there is anything lower than one star I will give it to them. I transferred money from my bank account to coinbase with the same name I used to register in coinbase, they are now holding my money for 7days said that it's their policy to hold my money for 7 business days before I could trade with it. This is the worst company experience I have ever seen. I can't wait to for the 7days to pass so that I will withdraw my money back and close the account. I will never advise anyone to use coinbase, they will wreck and frustrate you to the core. I regret ever registering with such a horrible broker.

list_of_reviews.review_title: I wish I could give them -5 star
list_of_reviews.review: I wish I could give them -5 star Don’t even think about them you are wasting your money you can’t call them and even you can’t email them just live chat which helpless since Friday when they didn’t let me transfer USDT to my platform wallet I’m trying to get my money back to my account but they don’t let me. If you really want to lose your money use their platform.

list_of_reviews.review_title: I signed up thinking Coinbase has been…
list_of_reviews.review: I signed up thinking Coinbase has been around for a long time. That's all I knew about the company. I'm surprised to find most aspects of the service are not in the interests of the customer. Not exaggerating, Coinbase is designed to charge as much as possible for every use case. I think it amounts to malicious exploitation of retail traders. The most obvious example is the lack of any available customer support or technical support.

list_of_reviews.review_title: The best Coinbase customer service I…
list_of_reviews.review: The best Coinbase customer service I received was from the Hackers that helped me back into my account and then stole everything. The hackers seemed to know that I was having issues getting back into my account. It was almost like they worked at Coinbase. I contacted them on "X" and didn't get a response for a long time. So I contacted them on Facebook and got a swift response. I sent them everything that happened with dates and phone records. Then dead silence.

list_of_reviews.review_title: I really miss the coinbase that I used…
list_of_reviews.review: I really miss the coinbase that I used to know cause the recent services i have been getting is so much discouraging and I can confirm from other reviews here that I am not the only victim. However, I got good report about To,Mver and i think its high time i moved there.

list_of_reviews.review_title: my account is locked and I cannot do…
list_of_reviews.review: my account is locked and I cannot do anything. Their help center repeatedly asking the same stupid question after explaining clearly. Now my investment is frozen. This keep happening Do not risk your money. I am going to write a complain

I don’t use coinbase anymore. I don’t understand why Trustpilot censor's me when I write a review. It was true! It was impossible to chat with someone about Coinbase One. I had to pay almost € 80 for nothing!!! I hadn't signed up for Coinbase One!!!!!3* because I haven’t used Coinbase since then. Maybe they help their customers now. If so, please return my € 80.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Extract key phrases and words that frequently appear in the reviews, which might indicate common areas of concern or praise for coinbase.com. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output:
Key phrases: "deposit and withdrawal," "customer service," "security," "robustness," "speed," "commissions," "KYC," "email spams," "easy to navigate," "beginner," "sluggish."

Explanation: Reviews highlight ease of use for beginners, efficient deposits/withdrawals, and robust security. Common concerns include high commissions, email spams, and sluggish performance.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Calculate the average rating from the reviews and analyze the distribution of ratings to understand the general user satisfaction level. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The average rating from the reviews is 1.25 (1+1+1+2)/4. The distribution shows consistent dissatisfaction, as three out of four reviews are rated 1, indicating generally poor user satisfaction.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Generate concise review summary to capture the gist of user opinions without needing to read through each review fully. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Recent reviews highlight mixed customer support experiences and inconsistent effectiveness, with some praising security and data privacy measures while others criticize sign-up issues and unhelpful responses. Ratings are generally low, indicating dissatisfaction.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Contrast the topics mentioned in positive reviews with those mentioned in negative reviews to determine key differentiators in user experiences. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Positive reviews praise robust security, confidentiality, and efficient customer service, while negative reviews criticize inadequate data handling, lack of transparency, high commissions, and poor customer support. Key differentiators are the effectiveness and transparency of data privacy and security measures.

prompts_output.Prompt: Considering the date, rating, title, and content of the review: Analyze mentions of customer support interactions in the reviews to gauge the effectiveness and responsiveness of the coinbase.com support team. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Customer support interactions are inconsistent, with mixed reviews: some praise quick and efficient service, while others criticize unhelpful, automated responses and language barriers. Overall, effectiveness and responsiveness appear unreliable.

overall_prompt_summary: The key findings emphasize the importance of effectively communicating changes to foster a customer-centric mindset among staff, which is crucial for implementing data privacy policies and enhancing customer relationships. Strategies for impactful results include defining activity groups aligned with business objectives, detailing tasks, assigning clear objectives, and linking tasks to a timeline, ensuring everyone understands their roles and responsibilities. In the context of employee benefits, understanding data flow is critical for compliance and risk reduction. Engaging team members, providing clarity, and using high-impact visuals are essential for successful transformation. Potential areas for improvement include deeper investigation into specific data flow processes and further strategies for maintaining ongoing staff engagement and accountability.

list_of_reviews.review: Masters of scamming and gaslighting. I registered my account with these thieves years ago, I had my ex husband's last name back then, now I am divorced and back to my last name and Coinbase is using this as an opportunity to con me and say that they can't verify my identify because my current name doesn't match my previous name. Are  you kidding me ??? They have all my previous and current photo ids, they KNOW it's me but they just want to lock me out and keep my money. And of course their idiotic system doesn't have support or a solution for cases like mine because God forbid that would mean they would have to actually work to solve the issue instead of letting the whole system being run by a dumb AI.

Coinbase has manually reviewed my account and I have not been able to deposit or withdraw money to my account for about 7 months. I am a Celsius creditor and they last contacted me a few months ago. After that, Coinbase has not contacted me in any way.

Although the technician was a little bit of a wise acre, he came through for me.This guy deserves a raise. I wish I could recall his name but he disconnected like the lone ranger.He told me that my phone is a subpar pixel and to stick with Motorola.I can't tell the difference. I just know that my app is fixed. Thanks.

Dont be fooled by the amount of users they have, there are much better exchanges out there, compared to bitpanda coinbase is like a high quality scam. Withdrawing my money was such a pain I gave up and kept it on coinbase, also fees are absolutely everywhere, i feel like ive been robbed to be honest.

I've tried to signup and as expected (they're a financial institution and they need to) they've asked for address verification.Then they rejected 3 different types of PDFs because they're not in English. OOOFFF.I've signed up for Revolut, Wise, Payoneer and wherever else you may think of, I have never ever dealt with such a LOL situation before.What a joke.PS: I don't even know if it's legal to reject an EU language if you operate in EU, but I won't bother with that, I have better things to do.Edit:Are you trolling me? I'm surprised to find most aspects of the service are not in the interests of the customer. Not exaggerating, Coinbase is designed to charge as much as possible for every use case. I think it amounts to malicious exploitation of retail traders. The most obvious example is the lack of any available customer support or technical support.

If there is anything lower than one star I will give it to them. I transferred money from my bank account to coinbase with the same name I used to register in coinbase, they are now holding my money for 7days said that it's their policy to hold my money for 7 business days before I could trade with it. This is the worst company experience I have ever seen. I can't wait to for the 7days to pass so that I will withdraw my money back and close the account. I will never advise anyone to use coinbase, they will wreck and frustrate you to the core. I regret ever registering with such a horrible broker.
